result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Preisler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam J. Preisler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam J. Preisler was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Calling 22CF145 & 22FO849. State calls Rhinelander Patrol Sergeant Christie Kondzela/sworn/direct by Sowinski/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Sowinski/cross by Magallones/Witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 02:54 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
